physical_appearance:The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The ceiling is white in colour and it has rectilinear lines running vertically and horizontally. Inside each big rectangle
 there are geometric motifs to form the shape of squares. Two squares are superimposed on one other
 with the one in below having a different orientation than the one on top. This allows for a figure that is similar to an eight-sided star to be displayed. Towards the bottom right hand side of the image
 there seems to be some cracks or chips on the white wall.

subject_terms_3:Rail transport Tanjong Pagar Railway Station Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Photography Rail transport (Stations)
sgcool_label_text:\This image shows the Art Deco and neo-classical styles of the Tanjong Pagar railway station
 which it was known for. Designed by Swan and Maclaren
 the entrance of the station is sheltered by an arched portico. This image is part of the \\Tracking Memories\\ collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore

metadata.creator_2: Kwek Leng Joo Swan and Maclaren Architects
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The ceiling is white in colour and it has rectilinear lines running vertically and horizontally. Inside each big rectangle, there are geometric motifs to form the shape of squares. Two squares are superimposed on one other, with the one in below having a different orientation than the one on top. This allows for a figure that is similar to an eight-sided star to be displayed. Towards the bottom right hand side of the image, there seems to be some cracks or chips on the white wall.

metadata.subject_terms_3: Rail transport Tanjong Pagar Railway Station Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Photography Rail transport (Stations)
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This image shows the Art Deco and neo-classical styles of the Tanjong Pagar railway station, which it was known for. Designed by Swan and Maclaren, the entrance of the station is sheltered by an arched portico. This image is part of the ""Tracking Memories"" collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore
